alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Wayne (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 11 at 2:33PM MDT until August 11 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Garfield County in southern Utah... Southwestern Wayne County in southern Utah... * Until 530 PM MDT. * At 233 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the headwaters of Sulphur Creek, Pleasant Creek, and Capitol Gorge. Between 0.3 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are possible, especially along Sulphur Creek. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, slot canyons, and normally dry washes. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Capitol Reef National Park, Torrey, Fruita and Caineville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
